newsitem.title: DENMARK: Tele Danmark buys German Talkline.
newsitem.headline: Tele Danmark buys German Talkline.

text.p: Danish telecommuncations company Tele Danmark said Wednesday it acquired Germany's Talkline mobile telephone company from RWE Telliance for about 2.2 billion Danish crowns ($331 million).
On June 13, Tele Danmark announced it was seeking to buy the mobile telephone company and was close to reaching a deal with RWE Telliance.

Talkline, which operates in Germany, the Netherlands, France and Belgium, was a subsidiary of German industrial company RWE, which is already a partner along with Tele Danmark in the MiniRuf paging system company.
"The takeover of Talkline means an expansion of Tele Danmark's telephony activities in Germany and Tele Danmark's efforts to integrate fixed and mobile telephone services there," it said.
Talkline is the second-biggest service company in Germany's telecommunications industry, with some 385,000 customers, a 7 percent share of the GSM mobile telephone market and sharply rising revenues.
